title: Who owns Alphabet in 2025? GOOGL shareholders explained | Capital.com
snippet: As of June 2025, the largest institutional holders include The Vanguard Group (7.73%), BlackRock (6.55%) and State Street Global Advisors (3.47%), followed by FMR LLC, Capital Research and Management Company, and T.

title: Alphabet Inc. - Wikipedia
snippet: Before it became a subsidiary of Alphabet, Google Inc. was first structured as the owner of Alphabet. The roles were reversed after a placeholder subsidiary was created for the ownership of Alphabet, at which point the newly formed subsidiary was merged with Google.

title: Who Currently Owns Alphabet? A Deep Dive Investigation
snippet: Alphabet Inc., the parent company of Google, operates under a three-class share structure that heavily informs its ownership and voting power dynamics. This unusual structure has Class A, Class B, and Class C shares. Each class serves a special ...

title: Who Will Own Google in 2025 - Exploring Alphabet Inc Ownership
snippet: Established on October 2, 2015, Alphabet Inc. was conceived as a holding entity for Google and its myriad ventures. The rationale behind creating Alphabet was to render the extensive suite of businesses more “streamlined and accountable” in their operations. This structural reorganization empowers each subsidiary to pursue innovative paths, fortified by centralized resources and governance.

title: Alphabet Inc. (GOOGL): history, ownership, mission, how it works & makes money – DCFmodeling.com
snippet: It's a structure built for long-term, founder-led vision. The company is steered by a seasoned executive team, with a clear focus on integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) across all business segments, a strategy that defines their 2025 outlook.
